Styleguide

Typography

All typography is set to system defaults. Likely San Francisco on Apple devices, Roboto on Google devices and so on.


Heading Level 1

As paragraph setting: browser default sizes and weight

Heading Levels 2, 3, 4, 5 and 6

Uppercase, bold and spaced

Paragraph text. Aa Bb Cc Dd Ee Ff Gg Hh Ii Jj Kk Ll Mm Nn Oo Pp Qq Rr Ss Tt Uu Vv Ww Xx Yy Zz 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 9 0 ! ? @ Â£ # $ % ^ & * ( ) [ ] { }

Colours

Default black (#000), default White (#FFF) and default web link blue, usually (#00e)

A class of .dim is used occasionally for utility content which washes out the opacity of black by 60%.

Layout

Measurements inspired by the Golden Ratio for paragraph spacing. Optimal reading line-length considered. Other measurements are simply enough to maintain a decent information hierarchy. Just enough from defaults.

About

I am currently Director of Design at Dawson Andrews and in the process of building the Research and Development part of the company. We'll explore interesting things like purpose, meaning and truth through technology. Want to join?

Newsletter

Sometimes I publish a newsletter called The Logbook which you can subscribe to here.
